intro: Lhotskya hirta, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and serrated, adapting to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Lhotskya hirta is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
